intro: Ozothamnus kempei, commonly known as the New Zealand daisy, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers and silver-gray foliage. The plant typically grows in coastal and subalpine areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Ozothamnus kempei is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its hardy nature and ability to attract pollinators.
